name: Envelope Follower
description:
This algorithm is a simple envelope follower. It outputs a CV according to the volume envelope of the input audio.

When operating on stereo (or multichannel) signals, it tracks the maximum of the various signals and outputs a single CV. If you want to separately track the left and right sides of a stereo signal, use this algorithm configured as two mono channels.
short_description: Tracks the volume envelope of a signal
use_cases: Volume envelope analysis for audio effects
Multichannel stereo processing (split into mono channels)

specifications.name: Channels
specifications.description: The number of bus channels to process.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: Output_mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

parameters.name: Attack
parameters.description: The follower attack time. Exponential scale from 0.1ms to 1000ms.

parameters.name: Release
parameters.description: The follower release time. Exponential scale from 1.0ms to 3000ms.

input_ports.name: Audio Input
input_ports.description: The audio signal input to be analyzed for envelope tracking.

output_ports.name: CV Output
output_ports.description: A control voltage (CV) output representing the tracked volume envelope of the input audio signal.

output_ports.name: Audio Output
output_ports.description: (Optional, if Output mode is 'Replace') The processed audio output bus. If not set to 'None', this follows the same routing as the Input or Output parameter settings.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: The output bus. If set to 'None', the input bus is used as output, and the mode is always 'Replace'.
